sample.title: Inside China‚Äôs Controversial $167 Billion Mega-Dam
sample.description:
In one of the most earthquake-prone regions on Earth, where the Tibetan Plateau meets the Himalayas, China is building a colossal hydropower system that will dwarf the Three Gorges Dam. By tunneling through mountains that surround the planet‚Äôs biggest canyon, the project is an ultra-ambitious gamble on clean energy‚Äìand one with potential consequences for China‚Äôs neighbors.

00:00 The Project of the Century
01:14 The Hydropower Potential of The Great Bend
02:49 Engineering the Impossible: Scale and Output
05:25 The Engineering State: Why China Builds
07:03 The Unseen Costs: Challenges and Risks
08:54 Lessons from The Mekong: A Downstream Warning
11:36 Geopolitical Fallout: India and Bangladesh 
13:47 A Planet Re-shaped 

Learn more: Why China‚Äôs Mega Dam In Tibet Is So Controversial - https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-12-16/why-china-s-167-billion-mega-dam-project-in-tibet-is-so-controversial

sample.title: How North Korea Hid an IT Workforce Inside US Companies | Bloomberg Investigates
sample.description:
This is the story of Christina Chapman, a suburban TikTok creator who ran a covert ‚Äúlaptop farm‚Äù from her Arizona home. The scheme became a gateway for North Korean IT operatives who infiltrated US companies and, according to the Justice Department, funneled millions of dollars to the North Korean government.

sample.title: Can France Fix Its Debt Problem?
sample.description:
Faced with rising populism and legislative gridlock, efforts to shrink France‚Äôs famous social safety net have hit a wall. We explore what could be lost, the risks of delay and what may force change.

Get the Paris Edition newsletter to make sense of what's happening in the city and what's next for French business: https://www.bloomberg.com/account/newsletters/paris-edition?utm_medium=social&utm_source=youtube&utm_campaign=originals&utm_content=newsletter&sref=bgqUwao5

sample.title: What does Christmas look like for Ukraine? | Global News Podcast
sample.description:
Russia has hits Ukraine with a massive attack, after President Volodymyr Zelensky warned of an increase in strikes during the festive period.
 
As Ukrainians prepare to celebrate their fourth Christmas since the full-scale invasion, Samira Hussain in Kyiv tells us how the war is affecting people around the country, and what hope they have for an end to the fighting.
 
Subscribe to the Global News Podcast wherever you get your podcasts or find more episodes here: https://bbc.in/GlobalNewsPodcast

sample.title: Vince Zampella co-created Call of Duty in 2003. #CallOfDuty #COD #VinceZampella #BBCNews
Labour deputy leader on Farage, EU and postponed elections | BBC Newscast
sample.description:
Today, Adam is joined by Labour‚Äôs deputy leader Lucy Powell to reflect on her first few weeks in the role and what lies ahead for the Labour government in 2026.  

The pair also discuss Health Secretary Wes Streeting‚Äôs new comments on the UK‚Äôs relationship with the EU, his leadership ambitions, and the importance of the party sticking together and showing a united front.  

Plus, how will Labour take on the political challenge represented by the Reform party and Nigel Farage next year? 

And, crucially, does she think that Keir Starmer will still be prime minister by next Christmas?

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews

sample.title: Civilians face devastating air strikes in rebel-held Myanmar ahead of election | BBC News
sample.description:
Thousands of civilians in Myanmar have fled their homes in recent weeks after the Burmese military launched a series of air strikes.
 
The junta has also launched a ground offensive in rebel-held areas, aiming to recapture territory ahead of phased elections that start on 28 December.
 
The election is widely criticised as a sham put on by the junta to legitimise its grip on power. It seized control of the country in a coup in February 2021 and since then Myanmar has been plunged into a civil war with rebel groups trying to overthrow the junta. 
 
The BBC‚Äôs Yogita Limaye, Sanjay Ganguly and Aamir Peerzada gained exclusive access to civilians and rebel fighters ahead of the election.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews

sample.title: Hundreds arrested in Africa-wide cybercrime crackdown | Global News Podcast
sample.description:
Nearly 600 people have been arrested in 19 African countries in an anti-cybercrime operation coordinated by Interpol.
 
Interpol said it took down more than 6,000 malicious links - which criminals send to people via emails or texts and can infect their devices. Three million dollars have been recovered.  
 
We speak to our correspondent in Johannesburg, Mayeni Jones.
 
Subscribe to the Global News Podcast wherever you get your podcasts or find more episodes here: https://bbc.in/GlobalNewsPodcast 
 
#Africa #Cybercrime #BBCNews
